Package goServer

Class GoServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • goServer.GoServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class GoServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Server to host games of Go New clients can connect, and are placed in a waiting list If there are two or more players, the first two players will be added to a new game
    Author:
    Huub Lievestro

    • Constructor Detail

      • GoServer

        public GoServer()
        Constructs a new GoServer. Initialises the clients list, the waiting list and the next_client_no.

    • Method Detail

      • getServerName

        public java.lang.String getServerName()
        Returns the name of the server.
        Returns:
        the name of the sever.
        Requires
        hotel != null;

      • run

        public void run()
        Opens a new socket by calling setup() and starts a new GoClientHandler for every connecting client. If setup() throws a ExitProgram exception, stop the program. In case of any other errors, ask the user whether the setup should be ran again to open a new socket.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setup

        public void setup()
           throws ExitProgram
        Sets up a new GoServer using setupServer() and opens a new ServerSocket at localhost on a user-defined port. The user is asked to input a port, after which a socket is attempted to be opened. If the attempt succeeds, the method ends, If the attempt fails, the user decides to try again, after which an ExitProgram exception is thrown or a new port is entered.
        Throws:
        ExitProgram - if a connection can not be created on the given port and the user decides to exit the program.
        Ensures
        a serverSocket is opened.

      • setupServer

        public void setupServer()
        Asks the user for a server name

      • removeClient

        public void removeClient​(GoClientHandler client)

      • respondHandshake

        public java.lang.String respondHandshake​(GoClientHandler handler)
        Returns a String to be sent as a response to a Client HELLO request, including the name of the hotel: ProtocolMessages.HELLO + ProtocolMessages.DELIMITER + (Hotel Name); TODO
        Returns:
        String to be sent to client as a handshake response.
